result.execSummary:
The defendant James R. Poikonen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/schooling or combination thereof, or any time he does not meet that requirement, deft must complete 9 hours of community service per week.

No contact with B.S. unless approved by PO. 

Absolute sobriety.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Completion of SAFE program intake and any counseling/follow up recommended.   AODA.  DNA sample.

State appears by ADA C.Plaunt; Defendant appears in person/in custody with Atty Tina Abernethy-Mays.
VRCW

State notes agreement as to sentencing recommendation.

15CF552>> Ct. 3 - 9 months MCJ w/credit for 339 days of time already served, and Ct. 4 - 90 days MCJ w/credit for 90 days of time already served, concurrent to each other, and to all other sentences; Any unpaid financial obligations to be converted to CV judgment.
16CF1410>> Ct. 1 -- 3 years TOTAL: 1 year Incarceration and 2 years ES, w/credit for 329 days of time already served; Ct. 4 - 9 months MCJ w/credit for 9 months of time already served, concurrent to all cases.
16CF244>> 7 years TOTAL: 3 years Incarceration and 4 years ES, w/credit for 397 days of time already served.
CONDITIONS of all ES: Any assessment/treatment/counseling deemed appropriate by PO; AODA and any follow up recommended; SAFE program completion; Absolute sobriety; FTE/FT or combination thereof, or for any week he does not, defendant must complete 9 hours of community service per week; No contact with victim unless deemed appropriate by PO; Any outstanding financial obligations are converted to CV judgment.

>>ALL sentences to run concurrent to each other, and to any sentences defendant now serving.
>>Any outstanding financial obligations are converted to CV judgments.

Defendant NOT eligbile for CIP/SAP in 16CF1410

Cases 15CF552, 15CF985, 16CF244 called: 11:02am
State appears by ADA M.Puerner.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Abernethy Mays.  
 Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW - victim impact statement filed

State moves to :
15CF985>>D&RI entire file
15CF552 - Cts. 1, 2, and 5>>D&RI
16CF244 - Cts. 2-5>>D&RI

PLEA:
15CF552 - Ct. 3 (Battery/DA)>>NO CONTEST
15CF552 - Ct. 4 (DC/DA)>>NO CONTEST
16CF244 - Ct. 1 (Burglary/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty.
Defendant makes statement - requests not serving any jail time.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held on all counts; 16CF244 Ct. 1--5 years Probation; 15CF552 Cts. 3 and 4--3 years Probation; All sentences concurrent to each other.
CONDITIONS: 16CF244- Ct. 1 only>>180 days MCJ w/huber for work/treatment/education if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, w/credit for 94 days of time already served, to begin within 45 days at the discretion of PO.
CONDITIONS on ALL COUNTS: Completion of SAFE program intake and any counseling/follow up recommended; AODA; Absolute sobriety; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or any time he does not meet that requirement, defendant must complete 9 hours of C.S. per week; CC including 2 domestic abuse surcharges; DNA sample and surcharge; No contact with victim B.S. unless approved by PO.

re: no contact order

Shall not consume alcohol. No contact with victim(s): B.S.-NON WAIVABLE. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. EMPD police escort to retrieve any personal belongings. 3rd party visitation through Family Resource Center.
